  29  """Definitions of objects used to generate Helas calls 
  30  (language-independent): HelasWavefunction, HelasAmplitude, 
  31  HelasDiagram for the generation of wavefunctions and amplitudes, 
  32  HelasMatrixElement and HelasMultiProcess for generation of complete 
  33  matrix elements for single and multiple processes; and HelasModel, 
  34  which is the language-independent base class for the language-specific 
  35  classes for writing Helas calls, found in the iolibs directory"""

  54 -    def default_setup(self): 

  55          """Default values for all properties""" 
  56   
  57          # Properties related to the particle propagator 
  58          # For an electron, would have the following values 
  59          # pdg_code = 11 
  60          # name = 'e-' 
  61          # antiname = 'e+' 
  62          # spin = '1'   defined as 2 x spin + 1   
  63          # color = '1'  1= singlet, 3 = triplet, 8=octet 
  64          # mass = 'zero' 
  65          # width = 'zero' 
  66          # is_part = 'true'    Particle not antiparticle 
  67          # self_antipart='false'   gluon, photo, h, or majorana would be true 
  68          self['particle'] = base_objects.Particle() 
  69          self['antiparticle'] = base_objects.Particle() 
  70          self['is_part'] = True 
  71          # Properties related to the interaction generating the propagator 
  72          # For an e- produced from an e+e-A vertex would have the following 
  73          # proporties: 
  74          # interaction_id = the id of the interaction in the model 
  75          # pdg_codes = the pdg_codes property of the interaction, [11, -11, 22] 
  76          # inter_color = the 'color' property of the interaction: [] 
  77          # lorentz = the 'lorentz' property of the interaction: [''] 
  78          # couplings = the coupling names from the interaction: {(0,0):'MGVX12'} 
  79          self['interaction_id'] = 0 
  80          self['pdg_codes'] = [] 
  81          self['inter_color'] = None 
  82          self['lorentz'] = '' 
  83          self['coupling'] = 'none' 
  84          # The Lorentz and color index used in this wavefunction 
  85          self['coupl_key'] = (0, 0) 
  86          # Properties relating to the leg/vertex 
  87          # state = initial/final (for external bosons), 
  88          #         intermediate (for intermediate bosons), 
  89          #         incoming/outgoing (for fermions) 
  90          # leg_state = initial/final for initial/final legs 
  91          #             intermediate for non-external wavefunctions 
  92          # number_external = the 'number' property of the corresponding Leg, 
  93          #                   corresponds to the number of the first external 
  94          #                   particle contributing to this leg 
  95          # fermionflow = 1    fermions have +-1 for flow (bosons always +1), 
  96          #                    -1 is used only if there is a fermion flow clash 
  97          #                    due to a Majorana particle  
  98          self['state'] = 'incoming' 
  99          self['leg_state'] = True 
 100          self['mothers'] = HelasWavefunctionList() 
 101          self['number_external'] = 0 
 102          self['number'] = 0 
 103          self['fermionflow'] = 1 
 104          # The decay flag is used in processes with defined decay chains, 
 105          # to indicate that this wavefunction has a decay defined 
 106          self['decay'] = False 
 107          # The onshell flag is used in processes with defined decay 
 108          # chains, to indicate that this wavefunction is decayed and 
 109          # should be onshell 
 110          self['onshell'] = False

 460 -    def check_and_fix_fermion_flow(self, 
 461                                     wavefunctions, 
 462                                     diagram_wavefunctions, 
 463                                     external_wavefunctions, 
 464                                     wf_number): 

 465          """Check for clashing fermion flow (N(incoming) != 
 466          N(outgoing)) in mothers. This can happen when there is a 
 467          Majorana particle in the diagram, which can flip the fermion 
 468          flow. This is detected either by a wavefunctions or an 
 469          amplitude, with 2 fermion mothers with same state. 
 470   
 471          In this case, we need to follow the fermion lines of the 
 472          mother wavefunctions until we find the outermost Majorana 
 473          fermion. For all fermions along the line up to (but not 
 474          including) the Majorana fermion, we need to flip incoming <-> 
 475          outgoing and particle id. For all fermions after the Majorana 
 476          fermion, we need to flip the fermionflow property (1 <-> -1). 
 477   
 478          The reason for this is that in the Helas calls, we need to 
 479          keep track of where the actual fermion flow clash happens 
 480          (i.e., at the outermost Majorana), as well as having the 
 481          correct fermion flow for all particles along the fermion line. 
 482   
 483          This is done by the mothers using 
 484          HelasWavefunctionList.check_and_fix_fermion_flow, which in 
 485          turn calls the recursive function 
 486          check_majorana_and_flip_flow to trace the fermion lines. 
 487          """ 
 488   
 489          # Use the HelasWavefunctionList helper function 
 490          # Have to keep track of wavefunction number, since we might 
 491          # need to add new wavefunctions. 
 492          wf_number = self.get('mothers').check_and_fix_fermion_flow(\ 
 493                                     wavefunctions, 
 494                                     diagram_wavefunctions, 
 495                                     external_wavefunctions, 
 496                                     self.get_with_flow('state'), 
 497                                     wf_number) 
 498   
 499          return self, wf_number

 501 -    def check_majorana_and_flip_flow(self, found_majorana, 
 502                                       wavefunctions, 
 503                                       diagram_wavefunctions, 
 504                                       external_wavefunctions, 
 505                                       wf_number, force_flip_flow=False): 

 506          """Recursive function. Check for Majorana fermion. If found, 
 507          continue down to external leg, then flip all the fermion flows 
 508          on the way back up, in the correct way: 
 509          Only flip fermionflow after the last Majorana fermion; for 
 510          wavefunctions before the last Majorana fermion, instead flip 
 511          particle identities and state. Return the new (or old) 
 512          wavefunction, and the present wavefunction number. 
 513   
 514          Arguments: 
 515            found_majorana: boolean 
 516            wavefunctions: HelasWavefunctionList with previously 
 517                           defined wavefunctions 
 518            diagram_wavefunctions: HelasWavefunctionList with the wavefunctions 
 519                           already defined in this diagram 
 520            external_wavefunctions: dictionary from legnumber to external wf 
 521            wf_number: The present wavefunction number 
 522          """ 
 523   
 524          if not found_majorana: 
 525              found_majorana = self.get('self_antipart') 
 526   
 527          new_wf = self 
 528          flip_flow = False 
 529          flip_sign = False 
 530   
 531          # Stop recursion at the external leg 
 532          mothers = copy.copy(self.get('mothers')) 
 533          if not mothers: 
 534              if force_flip_flow: 
 535                  flip_flow = True 
 536              elif not self.get('self_antipart'): 
 537                  flip_flow = found_majorana 
 538              else: 
 539                  flip_sign = found_majorana 
 540          else: 
 541              # Follow fermion flow up through tree 
 542              fermion_mother = filter(lambda wf: wf.is_fermion() and 
 543                                       wf.get_with_flow('state') == \ 
 544                                       self.get_with_flow('state'), 
 545                                       mothers) 
 546   
 547              if len(fermion_mother) > 1: 
 548                  raise self.PhysicsObjectError, \ 
 549                        "6-fermion vertices not yet implemented" 
 550              if len(fermion_mother) == 0: 
 551                  # Fermion flow already resolved for mothers 
 552                  fermion_mother = filter(lambda wf: wf.is_fermion(), 
 553                                      mothers) 
 554                  new_mother = fermion_mother[0] 
 555              else: 
 556                  # Perform recursion by calling on mother 
 557                  new_mother, wf_number = fermion_mother[0].\ 
 558                                          check_majorana_and_flip_flow(\ 
 559                                             found_majorana, 
 560                                             wavefunctions, 
 561                                             diagram_wavefunctions, 
 562                                             external_wavefunctions, 
 563                                             wf_number, 
 564                                             force_flip_flow) 
 565   
 566              # If this is Majorana and mother has different fermion 
 567              # flow, it means that we should from now on in the chain 
 568              # flip the particle id and flow state. 
 569              # Otherwise, if mother has different fermion flow, flip 
 570              # flow 
 571              flip_flow = new_mother.get('fermionflow') != \ 
 572                          self.get('fermionflow') and \ 
 573                          not self.get('self_antipart') 
 574              flip_sign = new_mother.get('fermionflow') != \ 
 575                          self.get('fermionflow') and \ 
 576                          self.get('self_antipart') or \ 
 577                          new_mother.get('state') != self.get('state') 
 578   
 579              # Replace old mother with new mother 
 580              mothers[mothers.index(fermion_mother[0])] = new_mother 
 581   
 582          # Flip sign if needed 
 583          if flip_flow or flip_sign: 
 584              if self in wavefunctions: 
 585                  # Need to create a new copy, since we don't want to change 
 586                  # the wavefunction for previous diagrams 
 587                  new_wf = copy.copy(self) 
 588                  # Update wavefunction number 
 589                  wf_number = wf_number + 1 
 590                  new_wf.set('number', wf_number) 
 591                  try: 
 592                      # In call from insert_decay, we want to replace 
 593                      # also identical wavefunctions in the same diagram 
 594                      old_wf_index = diagram_wavefunctions.index(self) 
 595                      diagram_wavefunctions[old_wf_index] = new_wf 
 596                  except ValueError: 
 597                      diagram_wavefunctions.append(new_wf) 
 598                      # Make sure that new_wf comes before any wavefunction 
 599                      # which has it as mother 
 600                      for i, wf in enumerate(diagram_wavefunctions): 
 601                          if self in wf.get('mothers'): 
 602                              # Remove new_wf, in order to insert it below 
 603                              diagram_wavefunctions.pop() 
 604                              # Update wf numbers 
 605                              new_wf.set('number', wf.get('number')) 
 606                              for w in diagram_wavefunctions[i:]: 
 607                                  w.set('number', w.get('number') + 1) 
 608                              # Insert wavefunction 
 609                              diagram_wavefunctions.insert(i, new_wf) 
 610                              break
